channel.title: New member group addition!
channel.description:
The staff team is happy to announce that a new member group has been introduced to Moparscape. From now, members shall be able to obtain the 'Community Member' status for Moparscape (separate to the Moparisthebest status).
We hope to see members added to the group within the coming days, so bear with us. :)
Moparscape Staff Team

item.title: New member group addition!
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

marcbob:

Explain to me why I should be able to be in-active somewhere but still keep my job because I earned it.

That’s such a terrible analogy, for one being inactive on an online forum doesn’t affect anything negatively, being inactive in a job means you aren’t doing your job (duh) which obviously affects the workplace negatively…

Read full topic

item.title: New member group addition!
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

That idea sounds good. I personally never really saw a reason why suggestion topics should have been hidden anyways. If they were deemed bad or unnecessary, they could have just been locked or deleted.

Read full topic

item.title: New member group addition!
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

The suggestions board had an issue with it, where people could see through the moderated posts. There has been discussion both among staff and members about it, one of the most popular topics is bringing it back but as a public board, and if there is enough interest it is moved to a staff board. As far as I’m aware there was no fix found that worked.

Read full topic

item.title: New member group addition!
item.dc:creator: @TabbyKiller TabbyKiller
item.description:
@TabbyKiller wrote:

[ul]Okay, summary time and what I believe is right.
[list]
[li]The title Community Member seems to be temporary or under consideration of being edited.[/li]
[li]The Bulbasaur badge is only temporary by the sounds of it. It is only used for sectional moderators at this time.[/li]
[li]Inactive staff members are not a problem, it can be solved by recruiting another moderator, you can never have to many.[/li]
[li]The veteran member group are for the people who have been around for a while and most likely have MoparScape history[/li]
[li]You can become a Community Member by suggestion of another Community and/or Staff Member[/li]
[/list]

Surely there is more but I’m not going to go through 5 pages[/ul]

Read full topic

item.title: New member group addition!
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:90, topic:516157”][quote author=Soulcist link=topic=634416.msg4283923#msg4283923 date=1366082727]

I think my favorite part is that there is so much complaining about elitism and epenis on this site, so much so that we do things like hide the vet rank, remove reputation, hide the IRC award, and things like that, and now we get a ‘new’ rank that pretty much screams popularity contest. Moparscape seems to be a lot like the tides :rolleyes:

I could go on about how much this site has changed since we’ve gotten new administration but it’s simple (to me at least) that because we’re growing (not sure on the statistics) on the team - they’re finally making some sort of change around here and that’s what we need.

I understand that most people on this site has attempted to make themselves popular (Hell I tried doing this) and it those people will tire out eventually.
[/quote]It’s not even really a change, it’s reverting an old change by creating a new rank of exactly the same description. Going backwards, not forwards.[/quote]
Talking about overall.

Read full topic

item.title: New member group addition!
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

Davidi2:

I think my favorite part is that there is so much complaining about elitism and epenis on this site, so much so that we do things like hide the vet rank, remove reputation, hide the IRC award, and things like that, and now we get a ‘new’ rank that pretty much screams popularity contest. Moparscape seems to be a lot like the tides :rolleyes:

I could go on about how much this site has changed since we’ve gotten new administration but it’s simple (to me at least) that because we’re growing (not sure on the statistics) on the team - they’re finally making some sort of change around here and that’s what we need.

I understand that most people on this site has attempted to make themselves popular (Hell I tried doing this) and it those people will tire out eventually.

As for the inactive staff members, I’ve came to realize that it doesn’t hurt, and it doesn’t hurt us. I’m sure a lot of these “inactive members” work behind the scenes without even posting so most of us act like we know what they’re doing behind these scenes. At this point, it doesn’t matter…

Read full topic

item.title: New member group addition!
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Tom, post:83, topic:516157”]The idea of such a rank has been circulating for a while, all staff members had a massive time window to post their views, and disagreements. We don’t extract peoples views from their heads in an extensive brain operation, they merely post/state their opinion and it is debated and discussed by all staff. This was the end result of these discussions, and this is what is staying. We have no intention of changing the veteran rank, or opening it up and the same applies for MITB CM.[/quote]In other words, MPSC CM is an exact replica of the old Moparscape vet, and current moparscape vets are now officially hipsters for being in the voted rank before it got remade.

I think my favorite part is that there is so much complaining about elitism and epenis on this site, so much so that we do things like hide the vet rank, remove reputation, hide the IRC award, and things like that, and now we get a ‘new’ rank that pretty much screams popularity contest. Moparscape seems to be a lot like the tides :rolleyes:

Read full topic

item.title: New member group addition!
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

[quote=“Jmood, post:21, topic:516157”][quote author=reyx7 link=topic=634416.msg4283246#msg4283246 date=1365996168]
Still not seeing an “I vain I” badge, for anyone who averages 10+ posts a day.
[/quote]

The amount of posts you have is nothing to get a badge for.[/quote]

'twas a joke. quality>quantity.

Additionally, @topic, although meaning similar things, we are all in the community, making community member simply a poorly sounding group. Veteran makes it seem like you’ve been there and you’ve made an impact. That’s what being a part of the forums is, not just a “member”, but a vet; hell, even legend.

Read full topic

item.title: New member group addition!
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

The idea of such a rank has been circulating for a while, all staff members had a massive time window to post their views, and disagreements. We don’t extract peoples views from their heads in an extensive brain operation, they merely post/state their opinion and it is debated and discussed by all staff. This was the end result of these discussions, and this is what is staying. We have no intention of changing the veteran rank, or opening it up and the same applies for MITB CM.

As for the inactive staff, I stand by the view that they do no harm to the community. If we need more moderators, then we will seek more moderators regardless of inactive staff. They have no effect on the community while they’re inactive, and only do good when they are active. As others has stated, staff aren’t paid and we don’t have timetables, this has led a lot of staff to prioritize their life leaving less time for mopar which is completely reasonable.

Read full topic

item.title: New member group addition!
item.dc:creator: @zuppers zuppers
item.description:
@zuppers wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:81, topic:516157”][quote author=zuppers link=topic=634416.msg4283814#msg4283814 date=1366073317]

On another note; I don’t really agree with adding a CM rank when we have a Vet rank which is literally the same thing. Vets had to be voted on, CM’s have to be voted on. It really doesn’t make sense to me. Whats even worse is we have other similar ranks such as Community Contributor (which only like silabsoft and frank_ have)

Anyways, I just don’t see why we can’t put the old vet membergroup back into play.

I was under the impression that the veteran rank was for long service members and that the community rank was for higher than average quality members.
[/quote]That’s not what the veteran rank was when I was there. But I guess they could change the definition of vet to be based on registration date, but that seems rather pointless to me.[/quote]I personally have no idea how the rank is attained. I’m just saying that is what I think when I see veteran.

Read full topic

I was under the impression that the veteran rank was for long service members and that the community rank was for higher than average quality members.[/quote]That’s not what the veteran rank was when I was there. item.title: New member group addition!
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“zuppers, post:71, topic:516157”][quote author=marcbob link=topic=634416.msg4283773#msg4283773 date=1366070614]
Explain to me why I should be able to be in-active somewhere but still keep my job because I earned it.
[/quote]Because it’s not a job it’s volunteer work.[/quote]This. This exactly. Mods don’t have hours they need to show up and do work, and they don’t get paid. Completely different than a job.

[quote=“marcbob, post:76, topic:516157”][quote author=rip4d link=topic=634416.msg4283796#msg4283796 date=1366072449]

If they ever decide to be active again. Can you name any mods who were inactive for long periods of time and then became active permanently?
[/quote]Si Force, for one.

Good point tbh, but didn’t he also lose his rank while he was inactive?[/quote]He chose to resign and then come back. If he hadn’t resigned, he would have just kept it until he decided to be active again.

I totally understand where you guys are coming from, but the only time I think we should be demoting for being inactive, is when a moderator clearly says they want to take a break from moderating. If they just show up less often, they are still a moderator.

[quote=“Newty, post:77, topic:516157”]On another note; I don’t really agree with adding a CM rank when we have a Vet rank which is literally the same thing. Vets had to be voted on, CM’s have to be voted on. It really doesn’t make sense to me.
Anyways, I just don’t see why we can’t put the old vet membergroup back into play.[/quote]Yea, that’s what I was saying as well. Doesn’t make sense. Just make vet visible again and you have exactly the same thing under a different name.

[quote=“marcbob, post:78, topic:516157”]How come you weren’t in the discussion for this? I figured they consulted all the staff[/quote]Few possibilties.

  1. He decided not to post in the discussion
  2. The discussion happened while he was away or on a medium he didn’t notice (like the staff IRC channel)
  3. The discussion was an executive admin decision (which I kinda doubt, considering a mod posted the topic, but you never know)
  4. His opinion was the minority in the discussion

Read full topic

item.title: New member group addition!
item.dc:creator: @marcbob marcbob
item.description:

If they ever decide to be active again. Can you name any mods who were inactive for long periods of time and then became active permanently?
[/quote]Si Force, for one.

I come and go. Evil was gone for a few years and came back for a few and no hes gone again. It does happen…

On another note; I don’t really agree with adding a CM rank when we have a Vet rank which is literally the same thing. Vets had to be voted on, CM’s have to be voted on. It really doesn’t make sense to me. Whats even worse is we have other similar ranks such as Community Contributor (which only like silabsoft and frank_ have)

Anyways, I just don’t see why we can’t put the old vet membergroup back into play.[/quote]
How come you weren’t in the discussion for this? I figured they consulted all the staff
